metadata.title: CVE-2023-3750 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in libvirt. The virStoragePoolObjListSearch function doesnot return a locked pool as expected, resulting in a race condition anddenial of service when attempting to lock the same object from anotherthread. This issue could allow clients connecting to the read-only socketto crash the libvirt daemon.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-3750` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-libvirt - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-clients - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-config-network - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-config-nwfilter - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-lxc - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-qemu - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-gluster - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-iscsi-direct - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-rbd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-storage-zfs - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-vbox - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-driver-xen - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-system - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-system-systemd - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-daemon-system-sysv - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-login-shell - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-sanlock - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt-wireshark - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
libvirt0 - 8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libvirt package in jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.0-1ubuntu7.6').
